name: Hotel Colonial Cayo Coco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Blau Colonial late August early September 2007 and found it hard to compare it to the reviews we had read before travelling. We were not alone, many people we spoke to said the same thing - the write ups were awful and we were dreading what we were going to find on arrival.
reviews.title: What's all the fuss about?

reviews.text: Fear not, the place was brilliant and I cannot understand the negative reviews.
reviews.title: Fantastic Cuba!

likes.liked: — Air con that worked, great staff, fantastic beach and surroundings

reviews.text: Our room was clean and large, air conditioning worked fine, and plenty of hot water! Daily maid service, plenty of towels, and if you needed extra water or anything then you only had to ask.
reviews.title: Return from Blau with great memories and diahrea

reviews.text: The food was good too, always a wide selection of fresh fruit and bread - veg, rice, pasta, pork, beef, chicken, lamb and fish, the puddings were also worth a second visit and this is just the buffet area! The Fontanella restaurant was very popular (Italian) and also the Seafood Restaurant - Ok so it may not be what you would eat at home - but you are not at home!
reviews.title: Paradise is putting it mildly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very very friendly and worked so hard to please, considering their wages (around 50 pesos per month) they always had a smile and a friendly word, if you needed something you just had to ask, and if you tipped then it was very much appreciated.
reviews.title: watch out for the mozzies

likes.disliked: — too many trees blocking the views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let us start by saying this was our second visit to Blau. We went to cuba last year but only for a week. We decided to go back this year and went for 15 days. What can we say the food is excellent, there is food for everyone e.g beef, seafood, chicken, ram, lamb, pork...... They did different nights as well, such as chinese night in the buffet with spring rolls, chow mein, szechwan pork and so on, it was lovely. Whilst being there we tried fish soup, ram, red snapper which was a delicate taste but lovely. They have 3 al a carte restaurants, italian , seafood and Cuban. They were all great especially the seafood where we tried octopus. The staff are amazing too, they cannot do enough for you, nothing is too much trouble. When we arrived this year they even remembered us from last year which was nice. When we went last year we went on the speedboat trip. This was very exciting but the snorkelling wasn't too good as you snorkel in the mangroves and the water is a bit murky, although it's still a good experience. This year we went on the catamaran, which was excellent, the snorkelling was better as the water was much clearer and you could see a lot more fish, we were also lucky enough to see dolphins on our way to playa pilar beach which is beautiful and very unspoilt. The food we had on this trip was fresh lobster and prawns done in a garlic dressing mmmmmmmmm. We also went on the lobster sunset at playa flamingo beach. There was a hut we all sat in directly on the beach to watch the sunset whilst enjoying more fresh lobster, prawns, cod, veg and rice which was lovely, especially the lobser. The last trip we went on was called Colourful Cuba. You go over the causeway to the mainland in to a town called moron. Let's just say this really opens your eyes to the fact that although they have very little, they are still happy and freindly. You go on a horse and cart around the town and get to have a look around the shops, if you go to the museum you get a good photo of the town. We also visited a crocodile farm which was a great experience as we held a baby crocodile. He was 2 yr old about a meter in length, so cute. The beach is beautiful too, the sea is like walking into a warm bath and so clear you can see where you step which is nice. To Sum all of this up Cuba is a fantastic country and well worth a visit, we will be going back.
reviews.title: Out of this world, one word that sums it up is paradise!

likes.liked: — You can do as much or as little as you like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What some people say about this wonderful hotel.Like many others we also read the awful reviews about this hotel!
reviews.title: Isnt it terrible
Cayo Coco
reviews.text: Thank god we took no notice and booked probably the best holiday we have ever had.

Let us assure you... this hotel,its wonderful staff,its cleanliness, delightfull selection of food,and its beautiful location will send you home, like us, totally relaxed and happy to have spent time with the wonderful Cuban people.
reviews.title: The Best service I have ever experienced

reviews.text: The entertainment provided especially the captivating romantic evening is as good as you will see anywhere in the world.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday

reviews.text: I stayed at the Blau Colonial from June 30th to July 14th 2007 for a 14 night stay with my wife and two boys aged 4 and 5. We had a great time.
reviews.title: It is definitely a 4 star! Great 2 weeks with family at the Blau.

likes.disliked: — Blocks 14 and 15 have no hot water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had booked this trip in advance and was constantly reading the tripadvisor reviews for this resort. I could not understand why some people strongly recomened the hotel while others did not at all. After spending 2 weeks there, I can honestly say that the Blau is a beautiful, friendly, and clean resort. I have read reviews on how people would rate it 1 or 2 stars. People should understand that the star rating system is based on the facilities offered at the hotel rather than the quality of these facilities. There are 4 star hotels which have a good reputation while others have certain weaknesses.
reviews.title: The Mosi Man

likes.liked: — How silent the place was. We got lots of sleep.

reviews.text: This resort lives up to it's 4 star rating as it offers room service, has sport and child care facilities etc. Like other hotels, this one has it's minor issues also. It's cuba and one must understand the limitations this country is faced with when it comes to the economy and quality of life.
reviews.title: For the conscious traveller!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only issue we had during our stay was that a couple of the hotel blocks had a hot water problem. Having two young children, this can be quite uncomfortable. We were offered another room and all was smooth sailing, thereafter. Problem fixed. Apparently, Blocks 14 and 15 are the ones with no hotwater. Some rooms in block 12 as well had the same issue. They do not seem to be working to fix the problem for the moment as it is a serious water main problem that effects 2 or 3 blocks. Be sure to ask for a room in either blocks 23, 24 or 25 as they are have running hot water. There was some talk about renovated rooms and non renovated rooms. I booked a standard room and was given a renovated room. I am not sure about the other blocks but I can confirm that blocks 14, 15 and 25 are all renovated. The rooms are very clean and spacious. Our room had a king size bed with two single cots for our kids, with plenty of room to move around.
reviews.title: Don't go to this Hotel ************* : (

reviews.text: The staff will do everything they can to make your stay pleasant. Just ask for what you need or want and they will help you.
reviews.title: Great Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, as I have read many of the reviews for this hotel prior to booking our trip, I was worried about a few of the very poor comments about Blau. I noticed however that just about every hotel has its bad comments just like it has good ones. People like to complain, plain and simple.
reviews.title: A Great Vacation

reviews.text: That said, some "comments" ARE warrented, although I wouldn't agree they should be as exaggerated as they are.
reviews.title: Good family vacation.

reviews.text: First off, Cuba is a beautiful country. Despite its different political standpoint, the cuban people are some of the happiest and friendliest I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. What people must remember when travelling to a country like this one, is that IT IS NOT HOME! You will not necessarily find the same comforts as you might expect from home.
reviews.title: Do not go to this Hotel ... it's awful!

likes.liked: — The Entertainment Team were the BEST!
likes.disliked: — Lukewarm food, Hotel in Bad state of Repair, Swimming Pool a Health Hazzard and terrible Mosquito Problem!

reviews.text: With that in mind, we travelled to Cuba with an open mind and mostly eagerness to visit another country, different to the ones we have already been to. From the reviews I had previously read, I had NO expectations on 2 aspects of my trip: the caliber/quality of the hotel room and the food.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Because of this, we found that we were very pleased with our overall experience. Also as a side note, I would like to point out that travelling to an all-inclusive resort will be a very different experience whether you travel during high or low-season. The summer is low-season. Nonetheless, the food wasn't amazing. It's food. We came to agree that it was Cuba attempting "american" cuisine and sometimes, fell a little short. That is not to say we didn't eat, there was plenty to eat, but I could definitely see a picky eater having a hard time in Cuba. (Also, from what I've heard and from people I've spoken to who have travelled to more than one resort in Cuba is that this is the case in all cuban resorts, their "fortes" are not american dishes) I would however like to commend the beach grill at Blau, "El Ranchon", their lunch meals are fantastic! At Blau there are also "international restaurants": a cuban, an italian and a carribean. These restaurants require a reservation but are quite good. The italian and the cuban were my favorites. The cuban had a banana stuffed chicken appretizer that was absolutely delicious as well as the pesto tomato cheese pie appetizer at the italian restaurant. I also read a few traveller reviews that said they had experienced a few "stomac difficulties" and we did as well but we chalked it up to the fact that our digestive systems weren't used to such a change in diet. My suggestion would be to travel with acidophilous bifidus (the good kind intestinal bacteria) which would help keep your intestinal flora at the proper levels. So, unlike some of the reviews here, I wasn't "outraged" in the least about the quality of food. I had a full stomac the whole time I was there and that's all that mattered.
reviews.title: Satisfied Customer

likes.liked: — the look of the resort, the beach, the snorkling excursion
likes.disliked: — the airconditioning, the food at the a-la-carte restaurants, lack of animation

description: The Colonial Hotel is located in the exclusive Cayo Coco to the east of Cuba. Our luxury hotel in Cuba has been completely renovated and reopened in 2011 as a four star hotel with new services and luxurious facilities. Colonial Hotel is the perfect place for a romantic get away or exciting family holiday. Enjoy some of the best beaches in Cuba while enjoying the excellent facilities of our colonial style Cayo Coco hotel.Discover our beach with its expanses of white sand and clear turquoise waters. Colonial Hotel offers a large variety of restaurants, mixed grills, bars and beer Gardenn. Our guarantee of top quality service makes us stand out.the hotel are invaitin to celebration the 20th aniversiti next year.
